document_data.name: Nighthunt
document_data.staff: [[Shaltana]], four daughters, six former adventuring comrades
document_data.mainbody: The '''Nighthunt''' was an inn to the east of [[Loudwater]] in the [[Delimbiyr Vale]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The inn was located one's day ride east of Loudwater, on the southern side of the [[Dawn Pass Trail]] to [[Llorkh]], near the [[South Wood]].

Structure.Atmosphere: It was a rather quiet and comfortable establishment. Although not famous, it was favored by local [[adventurer]]s, [[hunter]]s, and even outlaws in hiding, as well as [[Harper]]s and enemies of the [[Zhentarim]], of whom the innkeeper was a vocal critic.

document_data.Inhabitants: Around {{Yearlink|1365}} to [[1370 DR]], it was run by [[Ildur Arntar]], a former [[ranger]].
document_data.Rumors & Legends: There was a local tale of a [[ghost]]ly [[boar]] hunt being sighted on some nights, which would run into the South Wood. This was the source of the inn's name, the Nighthunt.
